questions.question: Break ………………………….. a piece of licorice for me.
questions.description: To break off is to tear off.

questions.question: The mainmast broke ………………………. in the storm.
questions.description: Break away means detach or separate.

questions.question: The trade unions broke ………………………….. negotiations and called a strike.
Give me a complete ………………………… of all the supplies you need.
questions.description: Breakdown can mean categorization or itemized list. Break down is a verb.

questions.question: The argument between the friends led to their ……………………..
questions.description: Breakup is a noun. It means separation or split.

questions.question: The train had a ………………………. outside of Seattle.
questions.description: Breakdown can mean failure or collapse. Break down is a verb.

questions.question: It is so cold you can see your ……………………
questions.description: Breath is a noun. It is the air from your lungs.

questions.question: You only have to ……………………….. that clear mountain air to feel rejuvenated.
questions.description: Breathe is a verb. To breathe is to inhale and exhale.

questions.question: I ……………………….. my hand while making soup.
questions.description: Burned and burnt are both correct as the past tense and past participle of burn.

questions.question: No one will eat that ……………………. cake.
questions.description: Only burnt can be used as an adjective.

questions.question: The burning building gave ...................................... an eerie light.
